INGREDIENTS:


•Bottle Gourd-Lauki- 3 cups chopped
 •Bengal gram dal-Channa dal-1/3cup
 •Onion -1/2 cup chopped
 •Green chillies -2 slit
 •Tomato -1 or 1/2 cup chopped
 •Ginger-Garlic Paste
 •Salt needed


Spice Powder: 

•Turmeric powder -1/4 tsp
 •Chilli Powder -1 tsp
 •Garam masala powder or kitchen king masala- 3/4 tsp
 •Dry Mango Powder/amchur powder -1/2 tsp


For the seasoning: 
 •Oil -3 tbsp
 •Cumin seeds -1 tsp
 •Red Chilli -1
 •Asafoetida/Hing


For Garnishing: 

•Coriander leaves (finely chopped) 


PREPARATION: 
 1. Peel the skin and cut bottle gourd into cubes. Chop onion and tomatoes finely. Slit green chillies. 
 2. Wash and soak chana dal (kadalai paruppu) for 2 hours. 


METHOD: 
 1. In a small cooker or pressure pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, when it splutters, add hing and red chillies. 
 2. Then add chopped onions, green chillies and curry leaves. 

3. Saute until onions turn transparent. Then add ginger garlic paste and saute for a few more minutes. 
 4. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, chilli powder, amchur powder, kitchen king masala and salt needed. 

5. Saute for a few seconds, then add chopped bottle gourd, channa dal and mix well. 
 6. Add 3/4 cup of water and pressure cook for 3 whistles. 

7. Once the pressure subsides, open the cooker, mix the contents and simmer for 5-6 minutes.You can adjust the consistency of the gravy as preferred. 
 8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with parathas or chapati. 
 This recipe is pretty simple with full of flavors and goodness.
